Posts.Content: Aug 19, 2012 11:24AM - edited Aug 19, 2012 11:25AM by sweetangel Dear Lord, I ask you to turn this weakness into strength, suffering into compassion, sorrow into joy, and pain into comfort. May your servant trust in your goodness and hope in your faithfulness, even in the middle of this suffering. Let her be filled with patience and joy in your presence as she waits for your healing touch. Please restore your servant to full health, dear Father. Remove all fear and doubt from her heart by the power of your Holy Spirit, and may you, Lord, be glorified through her life. As you heal and renew your servant, Lord, may she bless and praise you. All of this I pray in the name of Jesus Christ.

Posts.Content: Aug 24, 2012 07:54AM sweetangel wrote: Lynn, wow 5 yrs stable...I am so happy for you.....now I am day dreaming :-)..... My oncologist suggested that I try femara first, if it didnt work I can try other hormonal therapy as I am er and pr +.  It is just so hard making decision specially on this.......I do not wish to take taxotere ever again :(.......though it seems to work on me, it scared me on my 5th cycle as I thought I am having a heart attack.....on my 6th cycle they loaded me with benadryl and other pre-treatment meds to prevent reaction.  My body seems not tolerated because the meds is getting too much.  I never had any reaction before even chemo or other meds....but lately I've noticed anything I take I get reaction, even on my last scan, I had a reaction right away with the contrast which is unusual because I had it so many times in the past iwth no problem.
Posts.Title: Need your advise sweetangel jen_b

Posts.Content: sweetangel wrote: I just talked to my onco this afternoon,,,got my ct scan and bone scan result....to see how I am responding to my chemo treatment. Tumor on my liver has shown some regression, some lession are completely gone and two Of the big ones from left and right measures More than 2cm went down to 1.8cm....so it's good news for me. My 2nd bone scan result since diagnosis shocked me....the tumor somehow spread every part of my bones....sudden flare up of tumor which my onco couldn't explain. She said she will get a second opinion for the bone scan reading....somehow she is suspecting that the reading could be wrong or inaccurate? She is convincing me that if the chemo is working in my liver then it is supposed to work on my bones as well....could she be right? I need your opinion about this. I am so new with dealing this...she insisted that we should stick to my chemo regimen which is FEC. I need your advice Pls.... I am not sure what to do....or is there something I should do..... I feel like I'm fighting a battle when I didn't start a war... Dx 2/21/2011, IDC, <1cm, Stage IV, Grade 1, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Apr 29, 2011 04:24PM sweetangel wrote: I only found out I had a breast cancer because of severe abdominal pain, lower and upper part.  My family physician thought it could be a gallbladder infection.  He sent me to have an abdominal ultrasound and found out I had tumor in my liver....if not because of abdomen pain I wouldn't know I had stage 4 breast cancer and it spread out to my bones as well.  They coudn't even detect the tumor in my breast less than 1cm.....they had to biopsy and confirmed it was indeed a breast cancer.  I don't want to scare you but better to have it checked.  Jen
